rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: I've had Henry for both ENGL137 and ENGL105. He is one of my favorite professors at UNC. He is very knowledgable and definitely a unique professor. He is always there for his students and helped me develop a higher level writing style. He often goes on tangents, but they are always very interesting. I highly recommend taking his 105 and ENGL137.

Henry is very unconventional. The class is all discussion based and he usually lets the students determine what exactly you will be talking about. No tests and the reading is really unnecessary. He's a cool guy and as long as you participate and he can see that you're trying you will get a good grade.

Henry is great and really smart. He always tells you exactly what to do and lets you revise stuff a million times before you hand it in. I actually learned a lot in his class, even though I am not a huge fan of writing papers. Sometimes, he goes off on tangents but I always find his stories interesting and fun. Wouldn't mind having him again.
BEST PROFESSOR EVER, super understanding. Goes on a few rants in class but always interesting. Take him if you have the chance, you won't regret it!!!

He's a great professor! He gives a lot of busy work in the beginning, though. He requires you to post intermediate steps in writing paper, which can be annoying, but it stopped me from procrastinating. He grades pretty easy, and I think he is looking for improvement.

Fabulous Professor! Although most of the time he lectured on other things that didn't pertain to English, he was very interesting to listen to and is very intelligent. If you show an effort, you will do well in the class. It is possible to get a high grade in his class. You do have to buy the textbook however because you use it a good amount.
FABULOUS PROFESSOR. I loved his class. The material wasn't easy but his attitude and teaching skills make it an easy A. He's wonderful. 1010 definitely recommend!

He's such a chill guy, if you show up to class and write a decent paper you'll get an A. He grades a lot based on effort and he's very forgiving (I was sick for 2 weeks and he let me turn in everything later for full credit) I highly recommend taking him for 105

This class is relatively easy, but it is still not a joke. He takes writing very seriously. A paper was due about every week. Most lectures are completely unrelated to english, but he was an interesting professor.

Super intelligent. Although his instructions are not always clear, he is understanding and willing to help and encourages students to take chances in order to improve their writing. Very practical grader (as in he grades for grammar/technique/coherence instead of content), as well--so you don't have to worry if your beliefs don't match his.

Henry is very interesting to listen to.  Extremely knowledgable and passionate about teaching.  I enjoyed his class and the assignments were few and fairly easy.  If you want him to like you, participate.

Henry is one of the best professors I've had at UNC. I feel like out of all the classes I had my first semester at UNC, he was the one I learned the most from. Don't be afraid to talk in class and as long as you put in some effort, you'll be just fine. Can't wait to take his contemporary lit class!

Professor Veggian is nice but his assignments are really random. His directions aren't very clear and kind of expects you to know all this stuff you are talking about. Talk in his class and ask questions because his assignments are weird.

His courses are very reading intensive but the essays are short, open-ended, and graded easily.  I probably only finished about 4 books this semester and still made an A in the course. The class was kind of weird and I could never quite tell what direction we were going in but overall it was interesting.  Speak up or else he'll pick on you.

dr. veggian is the best teacher that i've ever had at carolina.  if all college professors were like him i'd never want to leave college.  literally he is that friendly and helpful.  take his class if you want to actually learn and succeed.

The class is easy and the material is, too, and if you put forth any effort you will do fine.  The writing assignments are open-ended so it is not very hard to do well on those.  Henry is also very approachable and easygoing.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Monje is super chill. He has experience in a lot of different fields, and that shows in his lectures and assignments. Very few assignments, and very easy. I never stressed about this class. Not the best at getting the schedule organized and sticking to it, but that doesn't make the class harder.
While, the instructor was helpful and it was not hardto get an A

Literally the chillest guy ever. I thought he was hilarious and super entertaining for a class that could have been really boring. While we did some technical stuff, he let us write about basically whatever we wanted every unit, unlike most other english 105 professors. I would definitely recommend it, easy A and awesome dude!
Outstanding professor!

David is awesome! He made English 105 enjoyable and I never stressed about this class. You just discuss in class and have occasional quizzes (which are super easy). You write all of the assignments outside of class and do peer edits before they are due. He is open to any writing style and a really relaxed, awesome guy. TAKE 105 WITH DAVID!

Super nice guy!!! He is so nice and passionate about just about any topic you can think of. Definitely would recommend him for English 105. He helps you get the assignments done ahead of time and gives lots of extensions if you have a busy week.
He is the best english professor you can ask for. Hes understanding and interesting and accessible in office hours. You will not regret taking this class with David.
Good professor. Easy grader on papers.

Monje is a super cool guy who is totally devoted to his students. His assignments are easy and broken down into smaller parts to ensure a great grade (not to mention he's an easy grader). Couldn't have been more happy in my ENGL105 class than with Monje

Good professor. Easy grader on papers.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: He is incredibly pretentious and do not think of sharing an opinion that does not align with his own. 3 papers , all 5 to 7 pages each, and 2 feeder assignments. He gives plentiful feedback on each paper, follow the advice and its not difficult to make an A. Agree with what he says and nod your head to lectures. Much harder than other sections.

David Ross is a spectacular orator. He is very knowledgable in subject matter and beyond. Helpful if you ask for it. Class not too bad, although it's quite a bit of reading. Show up to class for key points, take two easy multiple choice tests, and write two papers (with generous amount of time to do them) and that's about it.

He was the most annoying teacher. He talks everyday with a powerpoint, and talks about one slide for 15 mins. He asks questions in class and then when you answer he says "mm hmm" and then disagrees with you. He's so picky about giving As and if he gives an A it's an A-. There are group projects too. DON'T TAKE ENGL 105 WITH HIM, you will hate it.

Dr. Ross is a great lecturer and ENGL143 was very interesting. I would recommend this class to anyone that needs the VP credit. You watch 2 movies a week and discuss them in class. 2 papers and a midterm, basically minimal work. He is also a fair grader!

Dr. Ross is incredibly intelligent and interesting, but his lectures can get a little dry. He assigns three big papers, along with a few feeder assignments. In my class, we wrote a research paper, a restaurant review, and a film analysis. He provides helpful detailed feedback, and I feel that I have genuinely improved as a writer.

The class doesn't have too much work, but David Ross isn't very helpful at all. The class is very boring, he hates giving As (likes A-s and B+s the most) and he's extremely pretentious. He doesn't like it if you don't write in his style or if you suggest an interpretation of something for a project that he doesn't agree with. Find someone better.

David Ross is not what everyone says he is.  He knows that he is smarter than you and you constantly feel that idea swirling around your head during each lecture.  He is not helpful and very slack with grading.  I really wish I would have taken anyone else.  Please do not be fooled by these reviews, he is not a good teacher for ENGL 105.

Dr. Ross is a smart guy and I actually feel like I've become a better writer after taking his class. There are only 3 papers, and you submit multiple drafts, allowing you to receive ample feedback. He's kinda dorky and really into foodmovies, but he is a kind person and does not grade very harshly.
I learnt a lot from his class. He wrote very helpful comments and suggestions about my papers. This course was not hard: just three papers (each paper has three drafts)and two presentations.

Just absolutely spectacular. I think he's probably one of the few people in the world who can transition between quoting Lolita and discussing it without sounding artless, boring, and stupid in comparison with Nabokov's beautiful prose. He's a brilliant man and a great talker without being incomprehensible or condescending. Hope to have him again!

Good class :) He is ridiculously intelligent... could be the smartest person I've ever met. Uses lots of big words but not incomprehensible by any means. I enjoyed this class; great course structure and good book and movie choices for the most part :)

BEST CLASS I'VE EVER TAKEN. It's not suggested for the anti-intellectuals, but for anyone interested in quality film, it's a must. Ross is extremely passionate about film and is one of the most scholarly yet easy-going people I know. If you're reading the other comments, don't heed them unless you exclusively watch mindless blockbusters.

I took this film class because I thought it would be fun...BIG mistake! Most of the movies are incredibly long and hard to follow. It didn't turn out quite as hard as I thought, but the lectures are extremely boring, be prepared to zone out for the entire class.

He is really passionate about the literature, but his voice is rather monotonous. He doesn't really encourage class discussion, but his lectures are pretty good - if you can stay awake for them. Grading is not too harsh, but he expects a lot.

David Ross is a very smart guy. But his interest was watching 2001: A Space Odyssey(old edition). It was horrible. However I ended up getting a B out of the class with numerous visits at the writing center and his office. Make sure u get plenty of sleep before coming to his class because he can be boring!

Don't take this class unless you REALLY love sci-fi.  The work load is really heavy...about ten books and four movies to watch outside of class.  The exams don't really count, just the papers, so as long as you're a good writer, you'll probably do okay.  But David wasn't helpful at all, so be prepared.

Professor Ross is excellent. He is absolutely brilliant, offers excellent insights on the works we read, and I sincerely recommend anyone take him. One of the smartest professors I've ever had, and overall a very fair grader.

spare yourself the pain of taking his class.  He is VERY BORING and it is annoying to listen to his monotone voice.  You watch several sci-fi films and write 3 papers and a few feeders.  The work isnt hard, but the time spent in class goes by painfully slow.  he put me to sleep in every class.  try another english teacher, there has to be better

Dr. Ross is a wonderful professor. His insights into Romanticism are fascinating and I thoroughly enjoyed going to his class. If you are a dorky English major like me, you will really enjoy this class and Dr. Ross as a person. Very nice man, very helpful. Two 8-12 page papers, and a final exam with 50 multiple choice and two short take home essays.

B-O-R-I-N-G. Although Eng12 isn't supposed to be fun. The class was easy, he was just a very boring teacher. He doesn't really answer questions so much as talk about himself. He likes to slip in comments about The New Yorker at least once a week, which is extremely annoying.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Take this class!!. You must read the novels and shorts stories he assigns if you want to get a good grade. His quizzes are  very fair and he is a very fair grader on the papers. He was very willing to help students and would even take feedback from students. His discussions are awesome and thought provoking and he's hilarious!

Fletcher made a boring required class into an interesting one. He pretty much let us write about whatever interested us and we even got to spend a class at the Ackland art museum. The class was basically just 2 papers and a short presentation. A lot easier work than other 105 classes from what I've heard.

By far one of the best professors I have had at UNC. He is a great lecturer and really cares about the students understanding the material. You'll have to read, but the poems are relatively short and he makes discussion fun! I would definitely take again.
Really nice professor. Very involved and cares about his subject matter. Tries to be funny and engaging, but sometimes fails. Poetry is just a boring subject.

He's such a great professor! He was really helpful, insightful, and wanted you to understand the material. His humor is great, and that's what I looked forward to most in his class. He does grade papers somewhat hard, but it is fair.
He is super nice and helpful. As long as you put forth a moderate amount of effort you'll do fine.
Great most wonderful excellent teacher. Had him for 101 and 102. Best English teacher hands down. He's funny, helpful, and nice. Highly recommend.

He is the best teacher to get for English 101/102. I liked him so much that I told him for both. He is very helpful and he grades decently. If you try, you'll be fine. He's very funny and engaging. He is one of my favorite teachers.
Excellent professor; grades fairly but kind of tough on papers. Hilarious and entertaining, he makes you look forward to coming to class.
Incredible teacher.  Took the class just for fun and had a blast.  He makes going to class feel like it's worth your time because he makes it truly enjoyable.
I loved this class. It was at 8 AM and I still found myself excited about going!
Quality teacher. Not an easy A, but it is definitely the kind of A that you enjoy working towards. With his entertaining and effective delivery, he is excellent at teaching the works.
Awesome awesome awesome!  Take him for English 101!  He is so funny, easy going, and very helpful! Our class was a blast! I still say hey to him when I see him on campus!
Knows his stuff; absolutely hilarious; grades tough but fair

comments: She is the sweetest and really encourages her students to grow as writers.  Her classes are well thought-out and usually interesting.  As long as you participate, you should do well!
Class was very very easy we did thing with pictures and podcasts.  Only really wrote two pages. It was creativity class more than a writing class.
very helpful!
Ms Park is the best teacher!  She is so organized and her classes are so well-thought out.  I loved the material.  Great class!
No idea how to control class and no material really taught. Cute though.
Great teacher.  Always gave good feedback and wanted to help students progress as writers.  Classes can go by a little slow though.

We all have to admit, English 101 and 102 are really a pain to take, but if you have to Mrs. Park is great. She really strives to address you individually in order to help you achieve what needs to be done. Good professor, most definitely!
I love this class. I love this professor. She is the best.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Her classroom assignments are clearly defined. The paper may be very long but as long as you keep up with the readings you will be fine.

Never been a fan of English 105. That being said, it was still an enjoyable class. She breaks up essays into a paragraph/night sort of homework assignment. Make sure to check the assignments before every class! Homework is due every class day. Otherwise, a good professor and kind grader.

Kathleen is very granola, and a little bit older, but she's a lot more organized than the other ENGL 105 "professors" (TAs). That's an advantage, for me, at least, that she's an actual professor. There was more work than some of the other English classes, but it paid off in the end. Just turn in the work that she asks for, use staples, and ur good.

Professor Flanagan was a great professor! I didn't like her a lot at first, but if you seek the effort and get to know her better, she's extremely intelligent, very sweet, and always helpful. She grades very fairly; if you put forth the effort, you'll get the grade you deserve.
Professor Flanagan is a very good professor. She is very sweet and breaks down all the work into one to two paragraphs as homework. She grades fairly and pretty easily.

Dr. Flanagan is really into Pacific culture, and she's very well-informed on the cultures the class covers. The workload is manageable, and the midterm and final are fair. From what I've seen, most people receive similar grades on tests and papers (mostly in the A-B range). Class is treated like a seminar, so read the books at your own pace!

Started off pretty interesting but took a nose-dive after the second novel. Be aware that there is a considerable amount of poetry involved. Attendance mandatory and she uses the entire class time ALWAYS. Rather boring and EVERY work we read had gratuitous amounts of sexual themes; some borderline pederasty and others were outright incestuous.

She is a terrible teacher, easily the hardest grader in her department. If you want to make the deans list don't take this class, English 101 is to easy of a class to risk taking this professor. Good Luck.

Great Professor! Really nice and teaches class in a relaxed and fun way. I took two classes with her. One midterm & final(both: identification and an essay). Reading notebook (about 1/ 2 weeks), some reading but very interesting books. one 4-5 paper

Dr. Flanagan is a great teacher. she is really interested in the material and presents it in a fun and educational manner. Her classes were not very hard ( I had her for English 10, too), but I always enjoyed them. There is a fair amount of reading but it's well worth it!

YOU HAVE TO DO POSTS ON BLACKBOARD & THERE ARE NO TESTS OTHER THAN THE MIDTERM & FINAL & A COUPLE OF EASY POP QUIZZES IN B/W.  THIS CLASS WAS MOSTLY DISCUSSION & IT WAS MY EASISET  CLASSES. TAKE HER IF U CAN. THERES ALOT OF READING BUT I HONESTLY DIDNT READ ALL THE BOOKS/ARTICLES WE WERE ASSIGNED & I GOT AN 'A'.
Flanagan is such a nice professor. She expects quality from her students and a lot of reading, but she is leniant on grading and a pleasure to have as a teacher.

TAKE HER IF U CAN. THERES ALOT OF READING BUT I HONESTLY DIDNT READ ALL THE BOOKS/ARTICLES WE WERE ASSIGNED & I GOT AN 'A'.
Flanagan is such a nice professor. She expects quality from her students and a lot of reading, but she is leniant on grading and a pleasure to have as a teacher.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Love English, hated this class. We never knew what was going on because she was never clear. She never recalled what she said and constantly contradicted herself . Most frustrating class I've ever taken. Take someone else for ENGL105. You can only get an A if you're willing to try to do exactly what she wants (which you will never know).

I love this class, Dr. Frost leads amazing discussions and causes the class to feel more like a family. You won't want to miss this class because everyday is pretty much unplanned. You probably won't like this class if you're very shy but she breaks you out of your shell easily!

Coming from someone who has never enjoyed English, I really enjoyed this class b/c of Leslie. She is an extraordinary lecturer and engages the class in really interesting, deep discussions about the books read. Discussion is an integral part of the class, though you don't necessarily have to contribute. Leslie is easily 1 of my favorites professors

Dr. Frost is very intelligent, and she strives to have students emerge themselves in the issues they write about. If you put in effort for the class, a good grade can be achieved. I definitely recommend!
Dr. Frost is the best professor I have ever had!  Her class is so much fun, and I learned a lot.  I strongly recommend taking her classes!
Leslie Frost is my favorite professor at UNC. I loved her class she was extremely helpful. Almost all the readings were available online. Take a class with Leslie Frost.

Dr. Frost is a great teacher, especially for english 105. She divided are small class into groups and every group in our class got along so well. The class dynamic was great, she often didn't hold class, and was very understanding about assignments. The class only had 3 projects and each was set up very well. Highly recommend her!

I would really recommend Dr. Frost.  She was an excellent English teacher who taught with clarity and provided interesting and accommodating projects that helped me acclimate to college-level work and research. She is experienced and willing to go out of her way to help you.  Also very interesting.  Ask her about living in Turkey.

This class is honestly a lot more work than what I expected for an English 101 class and her late/attendance policy is a bit over the top. In the end, she is a great professor that makes an effort to get to know you and is always available in office hours. The class is intellectually engaging and class time is enjoyable. But, again, a lot of work.

She is really earthy and fun! But she gets frustrated when everyone doesn't participate in group discussion. So if you're not a big talker...don't take her. She has her favorites. Her class really doesn't make sense, but it isn't hard to do well in it. Tons of readings...i never read and I did quite alright!
Dr. Frost is extremely helpful. I have never enjoyed an English class so much.
There's quite a lot of readings, A LOT of class discussion, which i hate. but if you like it, you'll love her class probably

I hate english, but loved this class. It was very interesting, & all assignments were based on the West Memphis 3 murder trials. There are 3 big assignments and 4-6 small ones, but none are too hard. She holds office hours a lot and is willing to help you with papers. If you don't usually enjoy english classes, I strongly recommend taking from her.

Excellent Professor! Take if you can. She makes class interesting. There is a fair amount of work - 3 units with one or two feeders each. Nothing outrageous. Class structure is great - our class had the consistent theme of the West Memphis 3 for all assignment. Again, take her class if possible!

Interesting class, yet requires attendance and alot of work, but it is worth it in the end. Class participation is strongly encouraged and is a large part of the final grade. She is helpful but difficult to get in touch with.
Not that difficult. She's a little eccentric, and always reminded me of Miss Frizzle. I would recommend the class to anyone who has to fulfill this requirement.

Great professor. I decided to take her for English 102 as well. This class isn't just a walk in the park, as attendance and actual work is required, but, in return you get an enthusiastic professor who's not afraid to let students out early, bring breakfast to class. or get off topic. Actually learned a lot from this class. Worth taking.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Professor Cohen is an amazing professor. He is an excellent lecturer who not only loves his jobs but truly cares about his students. He gives excellent feedback. Professor Cohen aims to make everyone in the class a more critical reader and efficient writer. I would love to take another class with Professor Cohen.

Would love to take again.  Great lectures.  Participation is a must, but discussion topics are interesting, so participating is not difficult.  Wonderful professor.  Gives excellent feedback, is always available to meet and discuss classwork, and will go out of his way to help.  Truly cares about his students and their success.  Chose great novels

Marc Cohen is GREAT!!!!!! He is so helpful (if you approach him), and he is very flexible. I sent him my weekly schedule and he found a time that would suit both of us. He helped me improve my writing so much!

He brought us Krispy Kreme doughnuts. What more do you want? He is incredibly willing to help students by giving feedback on papers before they are due. He genuinely wants all of his students to do well and improve their writing.
He's the bomb. Bought us donuts at the end too.

Dr. Cohen is really helpful in office hours. He really makes himself as available as possible for his students. He gives amazing feedback on papers. The books were interesting and he led great discussions.

Prof. Cohen is one of my favorite professors I've had! He really cares about his students and takes time to get to know you. He is always so willing to help and really wants you to improve your writing in his class, which you definitely will. Definitely go see him in office hours, he'll tell you exactly what he wants to see in your writing.

Professor Cohen is a solid teacher. He is always in a good mood and excited to teach class. For our exams, we had to write essays and short answers, but he literally gives you exactly what is going to be on the test beforehand. He's really happy when you speak up in class or even just stay to talk a bit after class. Great experience overall!
Prof. Cohen goes above and beyond to help students. Your grade will be influenced by how much you utilize this help but he's very fair and the grading contract really helps.
Super awesome Professor, extremely helpful, my favorite professor yet

amazing professor! he goes out of his way to help you but his grades are based on how much you've improved so its a little difficult if you are a good writer but he really is awesome and if you do all your work then a moderately easy A.
Very helpful and interested in this subject.  Grading contract makes it east to get at least a B+.
The class is a lot harder if you are a skillful writer. He grades based on improvement, so if you don't have a lot to improve on at a 101 level, you're pretty much screwed.

At first, he it seems as if he will be a very helpful and insightful professor. However, as the semester wears on, it becomes evident that he establishes impossible standards for his students. He also puts a large amount of emphasis on personal preference. If he does not like a student for any reason, it will be very difficult to get a good grade.

Even though I have only attended UNC for one full year, Professor Cohen is the best professor that i have had thus far and will be tough to beat by any other professor in the future.  He was always willing to meet with you outside of class, which was a huge help for me.  After having Professor Cohen for two semesters, I can guarantee you that the grade you get for the class will reflect the effort that you put into it.  I highly reccomend that you take his class if you have the opportunity.
overall great teacher
He is very approachable. I got help before writing all of my papers and I think my writing skills improved greatly thanks to his guidance. Also, he's just a generally nice person!
he's vary pasionate
Good teacher.
Good teacher.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Super clear grading rubrics, easy grader, aka as long as you do the work and put in effort you get a good grade. He's a grad student, suuuuper understanding and willing to help! Also pretty funny, really passionate about film, which is awesome. Recommend!

Peter is a grad student at UNC-Chapel Hill. Overall, he's a good teacher. He has specific rubrics and if you follow them you'll get no worse than a B. The only problem I had with him is that it would take him a few days to return my emails.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: omg Laurel! such a sweet professor... if you are looking for a fun, easy and intriguing english course look no further! Laurel is 1000% there for her students and is willing to work with you outside of class .. oh and she's pretty
Super helpful
Laurel was an amazing teacher! Her class is low-effort as long as you participate and the homework is pretty easy.

She is awesome! One of the best professors I've ever had. She is willing to do anything to help you you good in the class. She is very sweet and will meet outside of class to help you at anytime. Take her class!

Very enthusiastic and really tries to encourage participation. Prepares you well for the tests. Wants to see you succeed and I don't think she ever said anything negative ever. Kind of spunky! She's a really cool person to get to know outside of class too and is always looking to talk to students.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Would not recommend this professor to freshmen. Class was based purely on discussion- if you don't contribute in every class you will fail. Also, heavy readings (more than 2 hours daily). Nice and approachable, but very hard.
Easy english class to start off as a freshman. He's really relax and if you have trouble with anything he's really helpful. Good teacher, makes the class interesting and not horrible.
English is sucky but Vaughn was great.  He's a great guy and the class ended up being fun.  If you have the chance, take his class.

Great teacher, I would recommend him. It's not your easiest A, but an A is very possible if you work hard and do all the assignments. He's very nice and encourages you to come into his office hours anytime. He makes class fun and interesting. I hate english classes, but I loved this one. Definitely take him for English 101 or 102.
No Comments

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Travis shows genuine interest in his students and offers a lot of suggestions on ways to improve your writing. He gets that this class is mandatory for all freshman and isn't trying to add stress to your schedule. Overall a great option for English 105!

Travis rocks. He takes genuine interest in his students & loves to see them succeed. Rarely do five minutes go by when the class isn't laughing at his wit and sarcasm; I wish he taught classes other than 105.  It isn't that hard for 105 &  the hour is spent discussing relevant events & interesting issues rather than dumb mandatory exercises. 10/10

Travis is a great guy. He understands that students are required to take English 105 and works to make the class as engaging and helpful as possible. We talked about politics, films and many other things in our pursuit to become better writers. Travis is an all around great guy as well and is very fun to engage with before or after class time.

Travis had the best hair out of any professor I have ever seen at UNC. He must use Head and Shoulder. Anyhow, his chiseled jawline combined with the attendance sheet makes me want to come to class every day. His unrivaled use of a blazer, as well as his amazing abilities to correct the most obscure grammatical issues, fosters a learning environment unlike any other I have had at UNC.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Dr. Stapleton is a fabulous professor who made 120 better than I ever though it could be. While he does give pop quizzes, it's pretty easy to guess when they will be. Basically goes over the entire reading in class so if you fall behind it's no big deal. GO TO EXTRA CREDIT! Show up to class + work hard + extra credit  achievable A in this class

Such a great class for my first semester at Carolina! I was skeptical on the first day, he likes to scare his students with the amount of reading required. It's definitely a lot, but manageable. Class discussions are extremely interesting, and he gives a lot of extra credit opportunities. Best literature class I've ever taken, fulfills gen eds.

Awesome guy, awesome class. He does assign a lot more than other 123 instructors, but I would take it again. Some of the books are a struggle to get through, though he provides valuable insight that make the readings much more interesting. Your first grade will be low, but he gives you the tools to improve it. Definitely recommend this professor.

Prof. S does assign a lot of assignments, but his instructions are very clear. He allowed us to discuss  and develop rubrics as a class, which helped. He really makes the students feel like their opinion and input matters. Expect multiple speeches. The texts read were difficult, but interesting. He is an awesome guy and an inspirational teacher.

Mr. Stapleton's class requires your to do more in other ENGL 105 classes. It's hard. However, grades are separated into mostly 5% and he helps you improve and make things better. The stuff we read in class was awesome and they offered me new insights. He's very helpful and responsible as well. A good instructor.

I am not gonna lie, this guy will make you do way more work than the other ENGL 105 classes, but unlike with those classes, you actually learn a lot and become a better writer. He's funny and extremely smart. If you're willing to write and are a decent writer coming into the class, take it. He genuinely cares for his students and gives you candy!
not easy at all

I absolutely adored Stapleton from the first day of class until the end, including the day he gave me my first D. He's tough but his expectations are attainable, with a little work. He's a "closet genius" in my opinion and very entertaining.  Plus he gave us the opprotunity to earn up to 11 points on our final grade. My first D became an A :)

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

Easy english class to start off as a freshman. He's really relax and if you have trouble with anything he's really helpful. Good teacher, makes the class interesting and not horrible.
English is sucky but Vaughn was great.  He's a great guy and the class ended up being fun.  If you have the chance, take his class.

Great teacher, I would recommend him. It's not your easiest A, but an A is very possible if you work hard and do all the assignments. He's very nice and encourages you to come into his office hours anytime. He makes class fun and interesting. I hate english classes, but I loved this one. Definitely take him for English 101 or 102.
No Comments

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: I never felt unsafe in a learning environment ever in my life until I took a class with this woman. She thinks her opinion is the only one that matters. If you offer a differing point of view or even just ask for clarification about an assignment, she will yell at your in front of the entire class. I once had a panic attack on the way to her class.

Dr. Crystall is by far the worst English teacher I have had in my education experience so far.  She is extremely vague, unhelpful, close minded, and disrespectful. I can't say I have ever enjoyed her class or her as a professor. Please avoid taking her class, no matter what it takes. The course work isn't hard but she is my least favorite professor

AVOID taking this class. She is very vague spacey, but manages to get snappy and angry when students make mistakes. I sat next to a slower boy in class, and she ripped into him often (cutting him off sharp tone eye rolling). SO RUDE!!  If you take it, buckle down, do your very best work, and always cover your butt by taking the extra mile.

Very closed minded/arrogant. I have seen her attempt to make students look foolish for questioning the vagueness of an assignment. Avoid at all costs. I would bet good money that she wrote the 2 positive reviews about herself.

Her assignments were very confusing and she was unclear about her expectations. She could be rude sometimes. She found no issues with any of my papers and I made As on everything, but I would really have valued some instruction there, as I really didn't know how to write college papers as a first-semester freshman.
Dr. Crystall was very unclear with most of her assignments. I'd recommend to avoid any class you have with her.
Really disliked Dr. Crystall mainly because of how unclear she was with all of her assignments. I'd suggest to not take any of her classes.
she is not a good teacher and does not respect others opinons.

If you are looking for a really easy class to fill your LA credit, TAKE ENGL 124!!! It's about graphic novels, which are essentially comic books.  Not only is it an easy grade, but the material is fun to read. Not a lot of effort needed. Two papers, two group discussions, a midterm, and a final. Great class, wonderful prof!!
If you have to rearrange your schedule not to take her class, do it.  It's worth it, trust me.  So mean and so stubborn.  A total headache.
No Comments

As previously stated, this woman does believe that her opinion is the only opinion.  As a very liberal person myself, politically and socially, I find her liberal bias in the classroom unnecessary and limiting to her young students.  She is SOOO politically correct that it makes real debate and dialogue in the classroom impossible.

She is an old lady that seems to be stuck in the past...She is strict, and makes me feel like I am in high school again..i feel very restricted in class. I wouldn't recommend her.  Hint:reasearch her name on the internet.....
a great teacher; entertaining and lively in class, kept discussion going; very tolerant of all points of view, even when we discussed controversial issues
Great professor. Very compassionate.
Not the best professor, but not the worst. She has her favorite students, just be willing to participate in class and show that you are intersted in her class. She is a fairly easy essay grader!
Why she is still teaching is a mystery to me.  Should've been canned a long time ago.  Freedom of speech for me, but not for thee.  Hypocrite.
Good lord, no!
booooooo...terrible

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Pretty boring teacher
She is so understanding and class discussion/projects are extremely interesting. She always encourages students to be creative and explore new ways of writing and thinking.

Will give you an A as long as you kind of follow along and turn in assignments. The only requirement for her papers is that they're on topic, they don't even have to be particularly good. Lots of readings but I just stopped doing them halfway through the course and that didn't lower my grade at all.
Super easy. She asked you to read a lot, but you could honestly skip it and be fine

She was amazing. Absolutely the best professor you can find. Gives participation grades for the most part and the class is mostly discussion. There are assigned readings but most of the time they're alright. I learned more from this class than any other, and I didn't even receive letters grades. She is the sweetest person and super willing to help!
Adra is so wonderful.  I can't imagine anyone not liking her class; it was the fastest 50 minutes of the day.  She's great.

She's currently working on her PhD, so she's super understanding about things coming up and very lax on most assignments. Some assignments are a little vague, but the class is relatively easy and she gives a lot of extra credit opportunities, too. Very nice person in general, and she knew everyone's names by the second day of class.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: He is an amazing person, and I learned so much from his stories. He helped me look at life from a new perspective. He genuinely cares about his students and loves his job. If you want an A, he will work with you to get an A. I learned so much and it has been the best class I've taken at UNC so far. Highly recommend!

Has to be one of the best professors at UNC. There is no one more keen to help his students and every single class is basically just story time where he imparts valuable knowledge. It was by chance that I got him as a professor and I feel incredibly lucky that I did

Lots of group works over the semester (especially towards the end), so it depends on whom you work with. He wants you to learn in class, so makes you work, but is very fair and makes getting an A very approchable.

One of the strangest classes I've ever taken. Every lecture consisted of him going on for over an hour about something unrelated to the topic (his daughter's horse) and he always ran out of time. However, he really cares about his students and makes it very possible to get an A in the class. I would recommend, but expect extremely boring lectures.
Dr. Hammer is wonderful. He is the most engaging teacher I've ever had. Expect to work for your grade, but the extra effort is completely worth it. I would take this class again just for fun

Here you have my favorite professor at UNC. The class is well organized, engaging, and generally a lot of fun. Dr. Hammer is the figurehead of this course and will learn you a thing so interesting you may fall out of your chair. I got through the week looking forward to his course. YOU MUST ATTEND CLASS.

Dr. Hammer made my first semester at UNC so much better than I had expected. I wasn't very excited to be taking an English class, but he made it into my favorite class of the semester. His lectures are fun and interesting. We were always very engaged, and he loved good conversation. I would highly recommend any of his classes!

Dr. Hammer was one of the best teachers I've ever had. It was a lot of work, but totally worth it. I took the Health and Medicine class and it was a huge help with those unfamiliar genres. He is a great professor, very engaging and interesting to listen to. We did get off track a lot, however, and ended up rushing the last unit. Great Class

Dr. Hammer always kept the class engaged, and was fantastic in the small class setting. Knew the students on a more personal level, and was incredibly helpful and engaging with them all. Was a very fair grader, and gave excellent feedback.

comments: The best teacher at UNC i think. Took her English 105 class T/Th and was never actually in class for longer than 30 minutes. She lets you go early every single day. Has way way less bs assignments compared to other English teachers. Wendy is the homie, take her

Dr. Weber's class was by far the easiest class I've taken at UNC. Minimal effort, no reading, no homework (she gives multiple class periods to work on assignments). She's not always clear with her expectations, but she is a super easy grader. She always lets class out 30 minutes early too.
So great. Very easy grader and very understanding if you cannot turn something in on time. Most of the class if working on your assignment and then getting to leave after 30 mins!!!
Weber is a nice and wonderful person. The workload isn't too rigorous. I highly recommend her!
Easiest class I've ever taken, including high school. Barely makes you stay more than 30 minutes and little work is required to get at least an A-
Wendy Weber is the bomb!  Very hard to get into one of her classes.  I was very lucky to experience her awesomeness!  The best/easiest english teacher
Easiest class I've ever taken in college and maybe high school. Don't need to buy any of the course material. She's really nice and lenient too, definitely try getting her!

She does not make you stay in class for more than about 20-25 min. I made an A- and did little to no work on the essays. Wendy is cool, just make sure you do the work. The book is not needed so don't bother wasting your money on it. Definitely take her class!!

Easy class and very helpful understanding teacher. There's a lot of reading but I did not read one book and made an A on the midterm. If you go to class, you'll do fine. 1 midterm, 1 paper, and final (all very easy and straight forward). Take this class if you want an easy A!
... if you go to class your fine, if you don't you need to read to make an A ... i didn't read any of the books and didn't go to class but still did pretty well with an A- ... not too bad at all
Really nice helpful & understanding.

Business Writing - SO EASY, so fun, really relaxed. Dr. Weber is great fun, easygoing and positive. She's also really funny and will tell you about her kids, and other tidbits from her life. I'd take her again in a heartbeat. One of the best I've had at UNC!
Class was really easy and fun.  She is really insightful too and open to input on class structure.  Only downside lots of reading.
Her class was easy and enjoyable, but there is a LOT of reading.
Good Professor-very helpful. Papers are easy-she is happy to help.
She is super easy. The class was never more than 20 minutes long. No one got below a B on any essay.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: He's a great professor that really cares about his students and will make you thoroughly enjoy the material. You can only have 3 absences, but sometimes he'll replace classes with one-on-one meetings. For his comtemp lit class you do have to read a lot, but they're all good books and there isn't much work beyond that

Great professor. He's a relatively young guy (30s), so he relates to students pretty easily, & is also pretty funny. My favorite part about him is his clarity: almost every class he gives a concise summary of where we're going & what we need to do, & then always asks, "any questions?" He grades fairly, so it all depends on the quality you put in.
Love him to death
One of my favorite professors!  He has great assignments and is always very clear with his instructions

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Awesome English 105 teacher! Great guy to be around. Glad I had him.

This guy is HILARIOUS! PLEASE TAKE THIS CLASS. It focuses on writing, but he tries to make the things we write about interesting. No final, just a final portfolio. He is so relatable and he really gives a "we are all in this together" vibe and he genuinely wants you all to succeed. For a class that I really didn't want to take, I loved it.

So so so glad I had Eric for English. As a freshman, he made me feel really welcomed to UNC and helped prepare me for the rest of my time here. I looked forward to coming to class. He's really funny and connected with all the students. He is very understanding and willing to help. He would also always end class early which is awesome.
Mr. Meckley was a wonderful teacher!  He's pretty laid back. For the "final" we had to just submit one of the 2 papers we wrote and a "podcast." I would recommend this class to anybody.
Mr. Meckley was a great teacher, he does contract grading so as long as you do the bare minimum you will automatically get a B-

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: The best teacher at UNC i think. Took her English 105 class T/Th and was never actually in class for longer than 30 minutes. She lets you go early every single day. Has way way less bs assignments compared to other English teachers. Wendy is the homie, take her

Dr. Weber's class was by far the easiest class I've taken at UNC. Minimal effort, no reading, no homework (she gives multiple class periods to work on assignments). She's not always clear with her expectations, but she is a super easy grader. She always lets class out 30 minutes early too.
So great. Very easy grader and very understanding if you cannot turn something in on time. Most of the class if working on your assignment and then getting to leave after 30 mins!!!
Weber is a nice and wonderful person. The workload isn't too rigorous. I highly recommend her!
Easiest class I've ever taken, including high school. Barely makes you stay more than 30 minutes and little work is required to get at least an A-
Wendy Weber is the bomb!  Very hard to get into one of her classes.  I was very lucky to experience her awesomeness!  The best/easiest english teacher
Easiest class I've ever taken in college and maybe high school. Don't need to buy any of the course material. She's really nice and lenient too, definitely try getting her!

She does not make you stay in class for more than about 20-25 min. I made an A- and did little to no work on the essays. Wendy is cool, just make sure you do the work. The book is not needed so don't bother wasting your money on it. Definitely take her class!!

Easy class and very helpful understanding teacher. There's a lot of reading but I did not read one book and made an A on the midterm. If you go to class, you'll do fine. 1 midterm, 1 paper, and final (all very easy and straight forward). Take this class if you want an easy A!
... if you go to class your fine, if you don't you need to read to make an A ... i didn't read any of the books and didn't go to class but still did pretty well with an A- ... not too bad at all
Really nice helpful & understanding.

Business Writing - SO EASY, so fun, really relaxed. Dr. Weber is great fun, easygoing and positive. She's also really funny and will tell you about her kids, and other tidbits from her life. I'd take her again in a heartbeat. One of the best I've had at UNC!
Class was really easy and fun.  She is really insightful too and open to input on class structure.  Only downside lots of reading.
Her class was easy and enjoyable, but there is a LOT of reading.
Good Professor-very helpful. Papers are easy-she is happy to help.
She is super easy. The class was never more than 20 minutes long. No one got below a B on any essay.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: pretty straightforward if you do the work and you'll do well
A wonderful T.A; He is very approachable and willing to meet before/after class
He really could less about you as a student. He will not grade anything or answer any of your emails. DO NOT TAKE HIM

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Shores is an amazing and dedicated teacher. She typically has a small class so be prepared to do the assigned reading or else it will really show in the class seminars. She is so helpful and provides amazing feedback on essays. I loved the class and her teaching style. Not very much work, but you have to put a lot of effort into the work you have.

Her focus on group work was too much for me, and will probably be the same for people who don't enjoy big group projects. She had surgery halfway through the semester and got a replacement to lead class, yet she continued to grade assignments. If she likes you, she's very helpful and always available for questions.
Slightly tough, but do your work and you'll be fine.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: I've had Henry for both ENGL137 and ENGL105. He is one of my favorite professors at UNC. He is very knowledgable and definitely a unique professor. He is always there for his students and helped me develop a higher level writing style. He often goes on tangents, but they are always very interesting. I highly recommend taking his 105 and ENGL137.

Henry is very unconventional. The class is all discussion based and he usually lets the students determine what exactly you will be talking about. No tests and the reading is really unnecessary. He's a cool guy and as long as you participate and he can see that you're trying you will get a good grade.

Henry is great and really smart. He always tells you exactly what to do and lets you revise stuff a million times before you hand it in. I actually learned a lot in his class, even though I am not a huge fan of writing papers. Sometimes, he goes off on tangents but I always find his stories interesting and fun. Wouldn't mind having him again.
BEST PROFESSOR EVER, super understanding. Goes on a few rants in class but always interesting. Take him if you have the chance, you won't regret it!!!

He's a great professor! He gives a lot of busy work in the beginning, though. He requires you to post intermediate steps in writing paper, which can be annoying, but it stopped me from procrastinating. He grades pretty easy, and I think he is looking for improvement.

Fabulous Professor! Although most of the time he lectured on other things that didn't pertain to English, he was very interesting to listen to and is very intelligent. If you show an effort, you will do well in the class. It is possible to get a high grade in his class. You do have to buy the textbook however because you use it a good amount.
FABULOUS PROFESSOR. I loved his class. The material wasn't easy but his attitude and teaching skills make it an easy A. He's wonderful. 1010 definitely recommend!

He's such a chill guy, if you show up to class and write a decent paper you'll get an A. He grades a lot based on effort and he's very forgiving (I was sick for 2 weeks and he let me turn in everything later for full credit) I highly recommend taking him for 105

This class is relatively easy, but it is still not a joke. He takes writing very seriously. A paper was due about every week. Most lectures are completely unrelated to english, but he was an interesting professor.

Super intelligent. Although his instructions are not always clear, he is understanding and willing to help and encourages students to take chances in order to improve their writing. Very practical grader (as in he grades for grammar/technique/coherence instead of content), as well--so you don't have to worry if your beliefs don't match his.

Henry is very interesting to listen to.  Extremely knowledgable and passionate about teaching.  I enjoyed his class and the assignments were few and fairly easy.  If you want him to like you, participate.

Henry is one of the best professors I've had at UNC. I feel like out of all the classes I had my first semester at UNC, he was the one I learned the most from. Don't be afraid to talk in class and as long as you put in some effort, you'll be just fine. Can't wait to take his contemporary lit class!

Professor Veggian is nice but his assignments are really random. His directions aren't very clear and kind of expects you to know all this stuff you are talking about. Talk in his class and ask questions because his assignments are weird.

His courses are very reading intensive but the essays are short, open-ended, and graded easily.  I probably only finished about 4 books this semester and still made an A in the course. The class was kind of weird and I could never quite tell what direction we were going in but overall it was interesting.  Speak up or else he'll pick on you.

dr. veggian is the best teacher that i've ever had at carolina.  if all college professors were like him i'd never want to leave college.  literally he is that friendly and helpful.  take his class if you want to actually learn and succeed.

The class is easy and the material is, too, and if you put forth any effort you will do fine.  The writing assignments are open-ended so it is not very hard to do well on those.  Henry is also very approachable and easygoing.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: I'm so glad I took Lithgow when I did because I'm able to write college level papers because of her. I would highly recommend her. You will most likely have homework due every class, but there is no midterm or final exam. Also, she helps you with literally everything on your papers and she is always available for office hours.

Lithgow was a phenomenal teacher. I had her for ENGL 105i and she's a huge reason for why I did so well on papers for other classes. If you try, you'll do fine. She cares immensely and is very flexible. Entertaining and open to new ideas as well.
She is a very involved teacher and wants everyone to do well. If you put in the effort you will do well.

Professor Lithgow is one of the most helpful professors I have ever had.  She gives deadlines if you need them, always offers helpsuggestionsoffice hours for any assignment, and truly cares about your education.  The class requires work, but she is extremely helpful through every step of her assignments.  Definitely recommend her.

Fabulous! Gives extensions, no questions asked, as long as you're 48 hours before the deadline. Class is discussion based. Reading is heavy (similar to ENGL 120), and she does quiz frequently, but she's a moderately easy grader on papers. Incredibly nice & supportive - couldn't recommend her enough!

Lithgow is the most helpful and caring professor I've had at UNC. Classes are totally discussion based. There are reading quizzes but they are super easy if you do any of the reading.  Also, Lithgow is an adviser in the English dept so she is super knowledgeable about the entire department!

Dr. L is a great professor. She is very thorough with paper comments and is helpful every step of the way. The research section of 105i is excellent and Dr. L did a great job with the material. Take the research ENGL105i with Dr. L if you can! Great transition class from high school to college.

I may have only been at Carolina for one semester now, but I know that Dr. L has got to be one of the best professors here. She is so energetic and really gets you excited about the class. ENGL 105 was easily my favorite class this semester,
My favorite professor i've had at Carolina so far.

Super helpful. There is a ton of reading for this class, and she'll quiz you on most of it. There is a LOT of listening to lecture, but it's not boring. Though attendance is mandatory, she's understanding of illnesses and will give extensions if you ask early enough.

Dr Lithgow is one of the msot helpful and engaging professor I met. She is pretty demanding for her students but she makes sure you become better in writing at the end of the course.the content is very engaging as well, but definitely need to put in the effort.
Lithgow is an extremely helpful professor who really attempts not to waste anyones time. Her classes are really engaging, especially for non-english majors.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Took Dr. Current for intro to fiction. She talks a lot in class but picks interesting books. Essays aren't too difficult and she provides feedback and the chance for a rewrite. Office hours were very helpful. Would take her again without a doubt.

I love Dr. Current. She's professional and really knows her stuff. I've taken multiple  classes with her. She really cares about you if you respect her and put in some effort. Don't take a class with her if you won't be able to dedicate a decent amount of time to it.

Dr. Current's class was almost unnecessarily difficult. She seemed like a nice person but she was very narrow-minded with how she wanted things to be written. When reading through comments on my papers, it felt as if she was marking them simply to have marked them. She rambles in lectures and is very hard on attendance. I don't recommend her class.

I really enjoyed this class. You have to schedule office hour time. The first two units require a lot of work, but are informative for those interested in health science. The last science fiction unit, however, was completely irrelevant. This class requires a lot of writing, but if you have a good foundation it'll be an easy A.

Loved this class. I was almost always behind in the reading so I didn't participate in discussion as much as I would have liked but Professor Current is one of the coolest professors I've ever had. Tons of respect for her.

Easy and fun. There is reading, but the books are actually interesting/entertaining. Try not to get too behind on reading, because it can be difficult to catch up. You can miss 3 classes, before it hurts you. Current is awesome! She encourages open discussion about many of the tough issues brought up in the books you'll read. Loved it!

Prof. Current is a great teacher and very accessible and helpful. She doesn't ask for much in terms of homework and you can pretty much BS your way around this class and get an A, if you really want to. She's a great teacher, very much interested in what she teachers and instills that interest in her students. She tries to help as much as possible.
Most helpful teacher I ever had. She was extremely helpful during office hours and shows real care for her students. But she is a tough grader and strictly adheres to attendance.

Very helpful and open to different viewpoints (she's liberal, I'm conservative, we're friends). Really wants to get to know her students. Gives fair grades and expects people to improve and participate. Lectures can ramble a bit, but it's not too bad. Lots of emphasis on the actual writing. Expectations are clear.

Current is really passionate about her teaching. She taught a variety of works in the class, from short stories to novels to movies. Class discussion was encouraged and was easy to follow. Assignments were hard and Current was very helpful with essays. She even had an option extra credit assignments for kids who wanted to improve in their writing.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Always engaging and made the small classes that I usually hate fun. Always available to talk before or after class and in her office hours. If you are thinking about taking 105i, TAKE BUSI 105i it is unbelievably easy. The most I wrote for an assignment was maybe two pages.

Super exciting and makes not so interesting material interesting. Really love her class and would take it again just for fun. Helpful, never patronizing (even if you ask a dumb question). Quizzes are super easy. Overall great professor and person

Professor Geil is the best! I took her for Popular Genres and it was my favorite class at UNC. She is very excited about teaching the class and willing to work with you if you need a deadline extension or something. Her quizzes are so easy and the class is actually fun. She grades on participation, so make sure to raise your hand. Highly recommend!
AMAZING professor!! she's flexible and understanding, but also sets reasonable expectations that aren't impossible to meet. She's open-minded and always willing to help a student.

I've only been at Chapel Hill for one semester, but thus far she is my FAVORITE professor by far. She makes class fun by being herself--which is corky and funny. She's a nerd and won't deny it. She's super understanding, helpful and encouraging. The biggest assignments we had were 7-8 paged paper and a group project. Fun class, fun teacher.

I took ENGL 105i - Writing in Business with Dr. Geil and it was a wonderful experience. I thought the class was very useful and I developed writing skills relevant to my future career. We also had a mock Shark Tank presentation, which was actually quite fun to work on. Learned a lot from Dr. Geil, guest presenters she brought in and my classmates.

Attendance is a must. Fair grader, very approachable and friendly. Two papers: One group based paper (5-6 pg) and Final paper (9-10 pg). Weekly quizzes-only to help boost your grade. 8-9 plays over the semester. Midterm: Snow days were a factor, so we had to write essays based on prompts. More  than likely you will take the standard midterm.

Dr. Geil was a wonderful and engaging instructor. She was willing to help with anything you needed and always took everyone in the classes' opinions into consideration. She illuminated the material in a way that seemed interesting to the whole class. (Oh, and she was occasionally hilarious.)

Take everything she teaches. She's funny and really knows her stuff. She pushed both papers back almost two weeks, and held extensive reviews for the midterm and final. Weekly quizzes are a great way to bolster your grade, and she drops the lowest one. She was always available for help with papers, and she'll even send promising sources your way.

Dr. Geil was so helpful and she was so entertaining. She kept her demeanor friendly and she was a bit quirky. She grades strictly, but fairly. The course was incredibly interesting and she was the primary reason for keeping it interesting as Shakespeare is sometimes difficult to grasp. I would absolutely recommend taking her class if you can.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: If you ask for help, she'll give it to you. However, three main papers make up 40% of your grade, so don't mess them up.

I had Professor O'Shaughnessy for 105i Natural Science and she is really nice. She did a good job of covering a lot of important categories of scientific writing (lab report, literature review, poster presentation, policy report, etc) and gave us a rubric for all the papers. Be prepared to do a lot of writing and make sure to revise papers

She's very nice. Took her for ENGL 105i for the Natural Sciences. Weekly reflections and responses to other students reflections that were two pages long. Keep up with assignments and you'll do fine. It is not an easy A, but it's not a difficult class. In class we didn't really learn anything. You learned more from sakai resources she posted.

Grading is pretty fair as long as time management is exercised. Be sure to revise papers (if you make the correct revisions, you'll do well on the major papers). Not a super easy A, but definitely doable.

She doesn't really teach you anything in class, you just kind of go to class to ask any questions about your assignments and she'll just post resources on Sakai. Grading is pretty clear. If you put in a good amount of effort you should be fine. Assignments were interesting since we got to choose our topics. Wasn't a super tough class.

Pretty good teacher.  Makes it clear what she expects of you, although the inclass assignments can be a bit ambiguous.  Just keep on top of your science writings and not wait until last minute to do your assignments and you'll do well.

The class was easy, but with the seven textbooks as well as online readings and weekly response writings, it keeps you busy.  She is kind but at times I felt like I was back in high school.  Boring class.  Also your grade largely depends on luck of the draw - your final presentation is with a group, and if one person does badly, everyone does.

This class is so easy if you just go to class and do the readings. She treats you as if your a high school student by retelling you what happened in the reading, so if you didn't do the reading, go to class. You can BS your ways through her essay and if you show her that your trying by asking questions, she'll give you an A. Do well on your papers!

This teacher has her favorite students and those are the ones with A's.  Everyone else gets what she thinks you deserve.  The class is super boring and the group work is so high school.  Also be prepared to read a lot of stupid novels written by dead people.
There is a lot of "busy work" in this class.  But, we got to go on field trips!  It's an easy class overall, but at times things can be stressful.  Also, be prepared to do group work.
No Comments
be prepared to work hard for your grade, i got an A- (that B- post was not true)
If  u can feel she doesn't like you, drop; HIGHEST u can get is a B-

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Sarah is AMAZING. She gives you a lot of time in class to work on assignments, she is SUPER flexible with due dates, and she simply wants you to learn. She is an easy grader and you are almost guaranteed an A! Take 105 with her!

Sarah was an incredible teacher for English 105. She was always very clear with assignments and their criteria. She was super flexible and always responded quickly to any questions. Easy A if you do the work and follow guidelines. Take her class!!!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Don't take her

She can seem intimidating at first, but if you take initiative and go to her office hours and truly show that you care about the course, she will help you! I'm horrible at English, but she made me a better writer by the end of the semester. Beware: She grades essays harshly, but the grade you earn is the grade you deserve.

Her critiques and grading are overly harsh, without offering any encouragement to motivate the student to want to do better. Her expectations of an intro comp class are unreasonable. To do well in her class, do exactly what she says, leave your creativity at home, and prepare for a ton of inane grunt work.
Dr. Rivard didn't mess around and definitely had high, but fair standards. Always open to meetings and discussions about projects, and really flexible around meeting timesoffice hours.

She was an excellent. I was a little intimidated at first but throughout the course Dr. Rivard proved herself very interested in her students and truly wanted us to excel. She's not afraid to admit when she's wrong and uses current research when teaching her students. She puts a lot of effort into preparing for class and keeps everyone involved.

comments: Sarah Boyd is amazing. I was dreading taking an english class for my LA credit, but I'm so happy I took this class. The books we read were really interesting and she made the class really fun. I would definitely take another class with her.

Except homework because since this is an English class there will not be a final and there are not test. Grading criteria could be clearer along with instruction for certain assignments. However she is always willing to help during office hours and she gives good encouragement. I enjoyed her and her assignments more than the actual classmates.

This class was pretty awesome. She makes the class interesting and is fun to have as a professor. Sometimes she can be a little tough on grading but you will get better because of it. The only issue was the scheduling of projects made some a little difficult to complete, but I'd still recommend the class.

I LOVED Professor Boyd! She was extremely relatable and funny throughout her lectures assigned very interesting and engaging assignments! Not the easiest A by any means but the class really gives back what you put into it!

She's a great teacher, very much interested in what she teachers and instills that interest in her students. She tries to help as much as possible.
Most helpful teacher I ever had. She was extremely helpful during office hours and shows real care for her students. But she is a tough grader and strictly adheres to attendance.

Very helpful and open to different viewpoints (she's liberal, I'm conservative, we're friends). Really wants to get to know her students. Gives fair grades and expects people to improve and participate. Lectures can ramble a bit, but it's not too bad. Lots of emphasis on the actual writing. Expectations are clear.

Current is really passionate about her teaching. She taught a variety of works in the class, from short stories to novels to movies. Class discussion was encouraged and was easy to follow. Assignments were hard and Current was very helpful with essays. She even had an option extra credit assignments for kids who wanted to improve in their writing.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Jennifer is very passionate about English and it shows in her teaching style. We did lots of small class activities that were tedious, but it wasn't bad. I have heard there are much easier 105 teachers though - Jen assigns difficult assignments compared to other 105 teachers.
Do Not take this English 105 teacher !!! YOU will do poorly !!! Its a terrible class and she makes it unbearable, wayy to much work!! Whatever you do, dont take her your gpa will suffer!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Always engaging and made the small classes that I usually hate fun. Always available to talk before or after class and in her office hours. If you are thinking about taking 105i, TAKE BUSI 105i it is unbelievably easy. The most I wrote for an assignment was maybe two pages.

Super exciting and makes not so interesting material interesting. Really love her class and would take it again just for fun. Helpful, never patronizing (even if you ask a dumb question). Quizzes are super easy. Overall great professor and person

Professor Geil is the best! I took her for Popular Genres and it was my favorite class at UNC. She is very excited about teaching the class and willing to work with you if you need a deadline extension or something. Her quizzes are so easy and the class is actually fun. She grades on participation, so make sure to raise your hand. Highly recommend!
AMAZING professor!! she's flexible and understanding, but also sets reasonable expectations that aren't impossible to meet. She's open-minded and always willing to help a student.

I've only been at Chapel Hill for one semester, but thus far she is my FAVORITE professor by far. She makes class fun by being herself--which is corky and funny. She's a nerd and won't deny it. She's super understanding, helpful and encouraging. The biggest assignments we had were 7-8 paged paper and a group project. Fun class, fun teacher.

I took ENGL 105i - Writing in Business with Dr. Geil and it was a wonderful experience. I thought the class was very useful and I developed writing skills relevant to my future career. We also had a mock Shark Tank presentation, which was actually quite fun to work on. Learned a lot from Dr. Geil, guest presenters she brought in and my classmates.

Attendance is a must. Fair grader, very approachable and friendly. Two papers: One group based paper (5-6 pg) and Final paper (9-10 pg). Weekly quizzes-only to help boost your grade. 8-9 plays over the semester. Midterm: Snow days were a factor, so we had to write essays based on prompts. More  than likely you will take the standard midterm.

Dr. Geil was a wonderful and engaging instructor. She was willing to help with anything you needed and always took everyone in the classes' opinions into consideration. She illuminated the material in a way that seemed interesting to the whole class. (Oh, and she was occasionally hilarious.)

Take everything she teaches. She's funny and really knows her stuff. She pushed both papers back almost two weeks, and held extensive reviews for the midterm and final. Weekly quizzes are a great way to bolster your grade, and she drops the lowest one. She was always available for help with papers, and she'll even send promising sources your way.

Dr. Geil was so helpful and she was so entertaining. She kept her demeanor friendly and she was a bit quirky. She grades strictly, but fairly. The course was incredibly interesting and she was the primary reason for keeping it interesting as Shakespeare is sometimes difficult to grasp. I would absolutely recommend taking her class if you can.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: He is an amazing person, and I learned so much from his stories. He helped me look at life from a new perspective. He genuinely cares about his students and loves his job. If you want an A, he will work with you to get an A. I learned so much and it has been the best class I've taken at UNC so far. Highly recommend!

Has to be one of the best professors at UNC. There is no one more keen to help his students and every single class is basically just story time where he imparts valuable knowledge. It was by chance that I got him as a professor and I feel incredibly lucky that I did

Lots of group works over the semester (especially towards the end), so it depends on whom you work with. He wants you to learn in class, so makes you work, but is very fair and makes getting an A very approchable.

One of the strangest classes I've ever taken. Every lecture consisted of him going on for over an hour about something unrelated to the topic (his daughter's horse) and he always ran out of time. However, he really cares about his students and makes it very possible to get an A in the class. I would recommend, but expect extremely boring lectures.
Dr. Hammer is wonderful. He is the most engaging teacher I've ever had. Expect to work for your grade, but the extra effort is completely worth it. I would take this class again just for fun

Here you have my favorite professor at UNC. The class is well organized, engaging, and generally a lot of fun. Dr. Hammer is the figurehead of this course and will learn you a thing so interesting you may fall out of your chair. I got through the week looking forward to his course. YOU MUST ATTEND CLASS.

Dr. Hammer made my first semester at UNC so much better than I had expected. I wasn't very excited to be taking an English class, but he made it into my favorite class of the semester. His lectures are fun and interesting. We were always very engaged, and he loved good conversation. I would highly recommend any of his classes!

Dr. Hammer was one of the best teachers I've ever had. It was a lot of work, but totally worth it. I took the Health and Medicine class and it was a huge help with those unfamiliar genres. He is a great professor, very engaging and interesting to listen to. We did get off track a lot, however, and ended up rushing the last unit. Great Class

Dr. Hammer always kept the class engaged, and was fantastic in the small class setting. Knew the students on a more personal level, and was incredibly helpful and engaging with them all. Was a very fair grader, and gave excellent feedback.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Professor GR is the best. She gives good feedback. I learned a lot about writing style in this class. It's an easy A if you put a little effort into it. It's a small classroom so she'll learn your name quickly and will ALWAYS be there if you need help.

All the unit projects assigned were easy to complete and the feeders felt graded fairly. Did learn some things about the writing styles in different disciplines but definitely just an appropriate amount for an introductory course. Participation in class is important, there is a lot of group discussion and  one group project. Overall, great prof!

Professor GR is such a great professor and so sweet. She provides personal feedback on all the work leading up to the unit project, which she grades rather easily. A lot of group work and projects, but an easy class. She always has a rubric and organized due dates. She makes a huge home cooked meal the last day, which just shows her generosity.

Excellent teacher, with a clear grading rubric (she's constantly telling you what you need in order to pass her class). Professor Gualtieri-Reed's style of Helicopter teaching helps you feel like you're getting individual attention. She knows everyone in her class, and doesn't hesitate to make jokes or laugh at jokes.  Has a lot of group projects.
